tutorial--welcome: let's learn how to use this chrome extension. click "next" when ready
tasks--task-find-placeholder: please put the task name here
stats-not-sufficient-record: not enough task record for graph
tutorial--task--allowed-sites: add allowed sites here, if the task blocks all sites. websites must be registered in 'websites' tab first.
tutorial--tab-websites: first, add rules from this tab to categorize website. task needs a website to work properly.
edit-website--url-not-match: url does not match with given regex(url)
tutorial--task--submit: this is submitting area. click this button to finish editing. or start/stop a new task for existing ones.
restart-tutorial-description: if somehow tutorial is skipped without knowing, try it again
websites--search-keyword-placeholder: put keyword here to search websites
patreon-link: please support this extension on patreon!
tutorial--tasks--btn-add: click plus(+) icon to add new item in current tab
donate-description: if you're pleased with this app, <lineBreak />please buy me a coffee<coffeeEmote /><lineBreak />or share your thoughts on <gitLink>this Github</gitLink>!
edit-website--test-url-regex-placeholder: test any url with given url(regex)
popup--no-task: no task detected<lineBreak />please add new task
site-blocked-no-task-description: try assign a new task before browsing
tutorial--website--url-mode: the extension needs rules to understand which url belongs to which site. 1) "plain url" means it'll only check if the given text is inside the url. 2) regex mode means it'll use "regular expression". it's for programmers or professionals. find regular expression from google. 3) the last one is simplified regex option. it'll skip protocol(www) check but otherwise uses regex.
newtab-description:
before proceeding to web pages,
please set task to get focused on your work
site-blocked-try-again-description: the tab is not closed yet. if your block setting just has been changed, try load it again
tutorial--website--url-test: type URL here, then check if it is recognized. it'll glow red if it does not match.
tutorial--task--block-mode: tasks can either 1) allow all sites, except predefined specific sites. 2) block all sites but allow predefined sites.
tutorial--task: this is what you'll see when adding a new task or editing a task.
tutorial--website--url-regex: type text or regex, according to the mode that have set earlier.
tutorial--task--max-duration: tasks can have time limit. after the duration, the task automatically stops and blocks all sites until new task is assigned.
tutorial--tab-tasks: then add task from this tab. tasks can be started or stopped from here too.
tutorial--tab-donate: lastly, if you enjoyed this extension, please check out this!
tutorial--tab-stats: after browsing internet with tasks for some time, check basic statistics from this tab. it also includes some miscellaneous options.
tutorial--website: this is a page for registering/editing a website
debug-mode-description: enables the extension's console message for chrome devtool
site-blocked-no-task: no task has been assigned yet
tutorial--tasks--searchbox: type keywords here to search items from current tab.
